title: Ariane 6’s first flight likely to slip into 2024
summary: Just over six months ago the European Space Agency (ESA) revealed the much-anticipated Ariane 6 would debut by the end of 2023, but now in the second quarter of the year, it is becoming clearer that the heavy-lift rocket won’t fly until 2024.

title: Starlink nears production facility completion, poised to drive subscriber growth
summary: The upcoming Starlink production facility in Bastrop, Texas, is nearing construction completion, which could become a sales growth driver shortly. Until recently,...

title: Space Force general: ‘No pushback’ from Congress on 2024 budget priorities
summary: The U.S. Space Force sees growing support from Congress for its plans to build large constellations in low Earth orbit and other priorities the service laid out in its 2024 budget request, the vice chief of space operations said May 15.

title: Italy awards $256 million contract for 2026 in-orbit servicing mission
summary: Italy’s space agency has awarded local companies 235 million euros ($256 million) in pandemic relief funds for an in-orbit servicing demo in 2026, the group’s leader Thales Alenia Space announced May 15.

title: Virgin Orbit Bankruptcy Auction Deadline Extended
summary: Virgin Orbit, the satellite launch company founded by Richard Branson, has announced an extension of the deadline for bids as part of its bankruptcy auction process.

title: NASA’s Artemis II Moon Crew Available for Interviews in Washington
summary: The four astronauts who will fly around the Moon on NASA’s Artemis II will visit Washington Wednesday, May 17, through Friday, May 19, to discuss their upcoming mission and are available for a limited number of in-person media opportunities.

title: Zephalto To Offer Michelin Star Meal Experience At The Edge Of Space In 2024
summary: France's Zephalto has announced its plans to offer stratospheric balloon flights to adventurous passengers starting in 2025.

title: NASA Ends Lunar Flashlight Mission Following Propulsion System Failure
summary: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) has announced the termination of the Lunar Flashlight mission, just five months after its launch.

title: JUICE Successfully Deploys Radar Antenna
summary: In a triumph of engineering persistence, the radar antenna on the Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (JUICE) mission, a European Space Agency (ESA) venture, has finally deployed after being stuck for weeks.

title: Astroscale & Momentus Partner To Offer Hubble Reboost Concept
summary: Astroscale and Momentus have annouced they have partnered together to present NASA a plan to raise the orbit of the Hubble Space Telescope.
